author: esgpool
title: Carbon Credit Methodology
description: Tous les crédits carbone ne sont pas créés de la même manière et il peut souvent être difficile de montrer la provenance. Utilisez les PS et le système Cardano pour améliorer cet aspect.

f6_assessments.q0:
The basic idea behind the proposal is interesting and it is in general really aligned with the whole cardano mission.
I see a lot of value in identifying and applying the carbon credit system to the SPs and to promote the adoption of carbon neutral stake pool operation. At the same time it would be good to expand the plan and better describe how this mechanism could become a new SPO business opportunity (in order to be better aligned to the challenge): the approach could be automated by an SPO and provided as a service for other SPOs? Or it is just related to the SPOs that receives Carbon credits that could spent in other ways?
It's important to expand the idea and describe more in-depth the mechanism involved in order to provide to CAs and voters a better understanding about the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unfortunately, as stated in the rationale for impact, the proposals lacks details.
It would be good to:
- provide an operational plan to describe how the promotion to SPOs will be conducted and the mechanism that will be used to audit and verify the carbon emission from stake pools.
- provide more info about the proposer, what are the skills required and provided to develop the proposal
- provide a budget breakdown with an estimation for each part of the project and the time/expenses that will be incurred for each stage
- provide a list of actionable items and deliveries as well as a timeline expected for each stage.
I suggest to the proposer to read the guide for proposers to write a proposal or follow the Catalyst School workshops on "How to make a proposal" in order to understand the level of details required to prepare a successful proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Unfortunately the KPI metrics are described only in a generic way and I don't think it will be easy to keep track of the progress of the proposal.
I suggest to adapt the current metrics indicated in something more objective that can easily be used in form of a numeric value. For example:
- Number of SPOs involved in workshops/meetings/social media content during the promotion stage
- Number of stake pools engaged to use the Carbon credit system
- Number of Carbon credits geterated
etc.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal have the potential of being impactful towards the carbon tax industry, as we are now moving towards a cleaner renewable energy. However, this proposal lack of detail on what are the solution they propose, and what are the problem exactly are they trying to solve. It doesn't articulate enough on how or why we should integrate carbon tax provenance system using Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: There isn't much explained in here, as who's the team are, how do they achieve those goals, budget details, roadmap, etc. This proposal mentioned that Verified Carbon Standard (VCS) Methodologies can be hard to develop and prove adherence to, but it failed to explain to us why and how do we solve this.
f6_assessments.q2: Again, there isn't much to go here either. The proposal didn't provide any clear platform, media, or links to track or check their progress. Overall, lacks of detail, roadmap, and key metrics.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about using Cardano to show provenance and audit results for verified carbon credit methodologies. This idea convinces me, but the plan does not. It seems that this proposal is incomplete [since there are no (1) Goals and targets; ( 2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge].   Based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 1.
f6_assessments.q1: It's difficult to evaluate an incomplete proposal [experience information, the team is too limited, doesn't have any roadmap or KPIs, and of course the risk is not defined]. Therefore, definitely, there are grounds to agree on the feasibility of this proposal, After all, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it with a score of 1."
f6_assessments.q2: For an incomplete proposal like this, auditability can't be guaranteed. The proposer should provide the following information: (1) Goals and targets; ( 2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge]. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well place within the challenge however it is unclear exactly how the proposal seeks to solve the problem of allocating the Correct carbon credits to each SP.
f6_assessments.q1: No information is providing about the team involved or where the requested funds are to be allocated other than creating a carbon neutral SP. A comprehensive breakdown of fund allocation would greatly aid this proposal in the future.
f6_assessments.q2: Whilst updates are promised at 3,6, and 12 months intervals the information to be provided in these updates is very vague and needs refining with measurable KPIs included.

solution: Utilisez Cardano pour montrer la provenance et les résultats de l'audit pour les méthodologies de crédit carbone vérifiées. Les FS peuvent aider à générer des crédits à vendre.
